radiographic_examinations.findings: No evidence of an acute intracranial process; finding suggestive of an inferior basal ganglia cyst unchanged from previous imaging.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The finding of the inferior basal ganglia cyst was unchanged from the CT performed 5 years earlier.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Stable, scattered demyelinating plaques; no active demyelinating lesions; no evidence of venous sinus thrombosis or cavernous sinus thrombosis.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: No changes over time; findings were stable.

radiographic_examinations.date: Not specified (performed on admission to the hospital)
radiographic_examinations.findings: Subtle leptomeningeal enhancement in the posterior fossa; T2-weighted FLAIR imaging showed signal hyperintensity in the sulci of the temporal and occipital lobes, and in the right posterior periatrial region corresponding to a punctate focus of restricted diffusion.

New hydrocephalus; progressive and extensive leptomeningeal enhancement; abnormal enhancement in the choroid plexus and ependyma of the lateral ventricles; extensive periventricular signal hyperintensity throughout both cerebral hemispheres; areas of restricted diffusion.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Progression noted with new hydrocephalus and enhanced leptomeningeal pathology compared to previous MRI.
